title: Is a 49 key digital piano good for someone who wants to learn piano? - Quora

response.answer_text: I will not recommend anything less than an 88 key if you are serious about playing. The keywidth is really small in a 49 key keyboard. In fact, it’s not even an real keyboard. It’s a toy. When you practice with a 37 or 49 key keyboard, your fingers become used to small keywidth. Then when you upgrade it to a real piano, you’ll find it difficult to unlearn and relearn. I bought a 49 key keyboard since I wanted to use it as the substitute for a hand organ. I hold it like the organ, vertically that is, and play with one hand. The keys gave me a hell lot of trouble at first. I had to constantly remind myself that it’s not a piano I’m playing. If you want to do anything that insane, a 49 key toy will probably serve well. But, if you’re serious, I repeat, if you’re serious then, don’t buy it. Rob a bank, extort a homeless dude, steal from your sister’s piggybank. I don’t care how you get the money. Just get yourself a real keyboard.

The answer is No. 49 Keys are not enough, but also the synthesizer's plastic keys are incorrect. If you want to learn piano you need to have the feel of a real piano.
